background: A company produces liquid and foam hand sanitizers, each requiring different quantities of water and alcohol, under resource constraints and a production preference.
constraints: Number of liquid hand sanitizers is non-negative
Number of foam hand sanitizers is non-negative
Total water used in liquid hand sanitizers is at most WaterTotal
Total alcohol used in liquid hand sanitizers is at most AlcoholTotal
The number of foam hand sanitizers must exceed the number of liquid hand sanitizers
Up to MaxLiquid liquid hand sanitizers can be made
objective: Maximize the total number of hands cleaned by the produced hand sanitizers
description: A company makes both liquid and foam hand sanitizer. Liquid hand sanitizer requires \param{WaterL} units of water and \param{AlcoholL} units of alcohol. Foam hand sanitizer requires \param{WaterF} units of water and \param{AlcoholF} units of alcohol. The company has available \param{WaterTotal} units of water and \param{AlcoholTotal} units of alcohol. The number of foam hand sanitizers made must exceed the number of liquid hand sanitizers. In addition, at most \param{MaxLiquid} liquid hand sanitizers can be made. If each liquid hand sanitizer can clean \param{CleanHandsL} hands and each foam hand sanitizer can clean \param{CleanHandsF} hands, how many of each should the company make to maximize the number of hands that can be cleaned?

parameters.definition: Units of water required to make one unit of liquid hand sanitizer
Units of alcohol required to make one unit of liquid hand sanitizer
Units of water required to make one unit of foam hand sanitizer
Units of alcohol required to make one unit of foam hand sanitizer
Maximum number of liquid hand sanitizers that can be produced
Number of hands that can be cleaned by one unit of liquid hand sanitizer
Number of hands that can be cleaned by one unit of foam hand sanitizer
